context.content: "Good Will Hunting" follows the story of a young janitor at MIT who has an extraordinary gift for mathematics. The movie explores themes of self-discovery, the pursuit of knowledge, and the importance of human connection. It's a heartfelt and thought-provoking film with a touch of humor.
That sounds interesting. Can you tell me more about the humor and heartwarming moments in the movie? I want to make sure it fits all my preferences.

The heartwarming moments stem from the deep and genuine connections formed between the characters, as well as the protagonist's journey towards self-realization and personal growth.
That sounds like a movie I'd enjoy. I think "Good Will Hunting (1997)" fits all the criteria I'm looking for. I'll definitely check it out. Thanks for the recommendation! [END]
